Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot.
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can illustrate different types of plants found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can illustrate different types of animals found in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can show how the types of plants and animals differ between the land and water habitats.
The student can use their drawings to demonstrate patterns of biodiversity, showing the variety of living things in different habitats.
